Posts.Content: Hi everyone! I am a 46-year-old mom and had breast cancer three years ago.  My tumor was removed and  I have been doing well with the exception of a large seroma which is about an inch in diameter.  I go to my oncologist every three months and have had regular mammograms.  I just had my mammogram last month and all was good with the exception of the seroma.  It is getting smaller but only about a centimeter at a time. I have read that the risk of infection is greater if I have it surgically removed. It is not painful and not visible to my physical appearance. Can I just leave it alone or it is dangerous if not removed? Will it eventually absorb naturally into my body?
Posts.Title: Is it safe to leave large seroma alone?
